SENT.plain: Discoid lupus erythematosus (DLE), the most common lupus erythematosus (LE)-specific chronic manifestation of the skin, is often resistant to therapy
Atrophy, scarring, and pigmentation are often observed
In this study, we report two cases of DLE that were successfully treated with tocoretinate, a compound containing a mixture of retinoic acid and tocopherol
Atrophy and pigmentation improved in both cases
The mechanism of action of tocoretinate is discussed
